column1: Your surgeon used an artery from your chest to create a detour, or bypass, around arteries that were blocked and could not bring blood to your heart.
Some patients may use oxygen when they go home.
- Your provider may recommend antiplatelet drugs (blood thinners) -- such as aspirin, clopidogrel (Plavix), prasugrel (Effient), or ticagrelor (Brilinta) -- to help keep your artery graft open.
- If you are taking a blood thinner such as warfarin (Coumadin), you may have extra blood tests to make sure your dose is correct.
Avoid any activity or exercise that causes pulling or pain across your chest, such as using a rowing machine or weight lifting.
